result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven J. Hoffmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven J. Hoffmann was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE must submit an apology to D.M.D. in a way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
DE to take all prescription medications in the way and manner in which they are prescribed.

timeConds.notes: DE must complete 25 hours community service within 90 days of today and with prior approval of probation agent

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
10:31 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowlege receipt of revocation packet and waive reading.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA states agents recommendation and agrees with that.  Comments by Atty Lex.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Court imposes on Ct 1 - 6 months county jail cs to any other in being, with huber and credit for time served.  Discussion regarding days credit.  DA and Lex to figure out.  Reimpose all prior monetary obligations with credit for payments made.  30 days from date of release to pay or CO.  

Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

11:09 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached. Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Count 1 and on motion of the State, dismisses Count 2.  DE to submit DNA sample to PRSO.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation:
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
DE must submit an apology to D.M.D in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
25 hours community service within 90 days of today with the prior approval of probation agent.
Continue counseling
DE to take all prescription medications in the way and manner in which they are prescribed.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not have contact with D.M.D., DOB 07-04-00.

1:30 pm - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 05-24-16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Court sets bond.
